meta.title: Architecture at UWE Bristol
meta.tagline: A guided journey for prospective students
meta.arbNote: ARB prescription transition confirmed to 31 Dec 2027.

scenes.label: Intro
scenes.title: Our School, Your Future
scenes.headline: A short welcome from the programme team.

scenes.label: Team
scenes.title: Meet the Programme Leaders
scenes.headline: Your guides through the course and beyond.

leaders.name: Dr. Yahya Lavaf-Pour
leaders.bio: Yahya makes sure studio projects are exciting and connected to real communities, and he’s passionate about creative design ideas that make a difference.

leaders.name: Dr. Eleonora Nicoletti
leaders.bio: Eleonora focuses on how buildings use energy and how design can help tackle climate change. She encourages students to explore new materials, technology and zero-carbon design.

leaders.name: Dr. Eduardo Costa
leaders.bio: Eduardo helps students use digital tools to design and make things. From 3D modelling to laser-cutting and new software, he shows how technology can expand your creativity.

footerNote: We are also proud that some of our students have undertaken their postgraduate studies at other prestigious Universities.

scenes.label: Bristol
scenes.title: Bristol: Your City Studio
scenes.headline: Live, study and create in one of the UK’s most creative and sustainable cities.

sections.title: Culture & Creativity
sections.copy: Independent galleries, design festivals and Bristol’s street art scene keep inspiration close.

sections.title: Green Capital
sections.copy: The UK’s first European Green Capital with ambitious climate goals and city-wide live projects.

sections.title: Connected Campus
sections.copy: Frenchay Campus is well-connected with excellent transport links, including buses, trains, and cycle routes, making it easy to access from across the city.

link.label: Discover more about Bristol on the UWE website

scenes.label: Why UWE?
scenes.title: Why Architecture at UWE?
scenes.headline: A RIBA Part 1 route with studio-first learning, live briefs and strong professional pathways.

sections.title: Professional route
sections.copy: RIBA Part 1 validated – your first step to becoming a registered architect.

sections.title: Learn by doing
sections.copy: Studio projects, technical workshops and live briefs with real sites and clients.

sections.title: Design for the future
sections.copy: Sustainability, climate resilience and inclusive places are built into the curriculum.

sections.title: Support that counts
sections.copy: Strong studio culture with clear feedback and guidance from tutors and technicians.

sections.title: Clear next steps
sections.copy: Progress to Part 2/ARB recognition at master’s level after this degree.

scenes.label: Year 1
scenes.title: Year 1 - Creative Exploration
scenes.headline: Start with the basics: creative design, understanding the environment, and exploring how architecture connects to communities.

tiles.deliverable: Learning how buildings respond to climate
Discovering how places and people shape design

scenes.label: Year 2
scenes.title: Year 2 - Depth and Development
scenes.headline: Take on bigger projects, dive deeper into technology, and understand how architects work in practice.

tiles.deliverable: Learning how design and practice fit together

scenes.label: Year 3
scenes.title: Year 3 - Integrated Thinking
scenes.headline: Bring everything together in a major design project, backed by technical and professional thinking.

tiles.deliverable: Your final design thesis project where you design your own brief tailored to your interests
Showing how your ideas work in detail
Presenting yourself as a future architect

scenes.label: Studio
scenes.title: The Studio at the Heart
scenes.headline: Our studios are the beating heart of the course — where design, debate and making come together every day.

pins.title: Digital & CAD Studios
pins.caption: Light-filled studios connect digital modelling with lively desk-based tutorials — a space to think, share, and grow as a designer.

pins.title: Model Making & 3D Printing
pins.caption: From laser cutting to 3D printing, students prototype ideas at speed — testing concepts through hands-on making.

pins.title: Workshops & Fabrication
pins.caption: Wood, metal and fabrication workshops give the freedom to work at scale, pushing creativity from sketch to structure.

scenes.label: Structure
scenes.title: Programme Structure
scenes.headline: A coordinated programme of study across the three years.

scenes.label: Live
scenes.title: Live Projects • Fieldwork • Bristol as Lab
scenes.headline: We treat the city as a design laboratory — learning through action, making, and collaboration.

tiles.title: Live Projects
tiles.caption: Students co-create with communities — from gardens and installations to civic spaces that make a visible difference.

tiles.title: Fieldwork
tiles.caption: Observation, sketching and mapping on site — design begins with being present, noticing, and engaging directly with place.

tiles.title: Inclusive Practice
tiles.caption: Building together — real structures and shared spaces emerge through collaboration, testing inclusivity in practice.

tiles.title: Sustainability
tiles.caption: From hempcrete to circular design, our projects challenge material conventions and explore resilient futures.

scenes.label: Global
scenes.title: Go Wider: Exchanges
scenes.headline: Explore Full-Year Exchanges In Europe In Year 3

partners.summary: Design for dense European cities with studios framed by Paris’ cultural districts.
Cross-continental campus life exploring adaptive reuse and resilient megacity design.
Deepen technical detailing with German building science and collaborative labs.
Dense urban interventions with Italian craft traditions.
Historic campus studios tackling regeneration across Emilia-Romagna.
Digital fabrication labs paired with sustainable timber construction studios.
Landscape-led design studios focusing on riverfront and coastal resilience.
Live briefs in the Loire Valley exploring heritage conservation and urban change.

scenes.label: Outcomes
scenes.title: Recognised and ready for practice
scenes.headline: Independent survey data shows the impact of studying Architecture at UWE Bristol.

stats.metric: Top 15 in the UK for Architecture
Students say their views are valued
Students say feedback improved their work

narrative.title: Your Student Experience
narrative.text: Studying Architecture at UWE Bristol means joining a course where your experience is at the centre. You’ll be supported by committed tutors, work alongside peers in an inclusive community, and gain confidence through mentoring with practising architects. Our students don’t just learn — they make an impact. Recent graduates have won RIBA and Civic Trust awards and been nominated for the RIBA President’s Medal, showing how experience translates into nationally recognised achievement. You’ll graduate prepared for both practice and the wider world.

scenes.label: Next Steps
scenes.title: Your Professional Pathway
scenes.headline: From UWE Bristol to ARB registration

steps.title: Entry Qualifications
steps.description: A-Levels, BTEC, foundation diploma or equivalent preparation.

steps.title: BSc (Hons) Architecture
steps.description: Three-year honours degree giving you a RIBA Part 1.

steps.title: MArch Architecture
steps.description: You will need a qualification that meets ARB's Academic Outcomes from a provider accredited by ARB.

steps.title: Professional Experience
steps.description: Log at least 12 months of PEDR-recorded experience after Part I, and another 12 months after Part II, to prepare for Part III.

steps.title: Professional Practice
steps.description: A course covering contracts, law and management that meets ARB's Practice Outcomes.

steps.title: Join the ARB
steps.description: Apply for UK registration as a qualified 'Architect' prepared for a career in architecture.

note.title: PEDR professional practice
note.description: Your experience is recorded between academic stages using the RIBA PEDR logbook, keeping you on track for chartered status.

scenes.accreditationDescription: Our BSc (Hons) Architecture course at UWE Bristol is validated by the Royal Institute of British Architects (RIBA). It is also accredited by the Board of Architects Malaysia (LAM), giving your degree global portability. Successful completion provides the academic requirement for progression to postgraduate study and eventual Architects Registration Board (ARB) registration in the UK.

accreditations.label: RIBA Validated
accreditations.alt: Royal Institute of British Architects validation logo

accreditations.label: Board of Architects Malaysia
accreditations.alt: Board of Architects Malaysia (LAM) accreditation logo

scenes.headline: Architecture and design practices our graduates have joined.
footerNote: We are also proud that some of our students have undertaken their postgraduate studies at other prestigious Universities.

scenes.label: Get involved
scenes.title: You can get involved
scenes.headline: Make the most of Frenchay Campus with clubs, sport, music and everyday support.

features.title: Architecture Society
features.description: Student-led events and socials for Architecture students across all year groups.
points: Mixers, exhibition trips and guest speakers hosted by Architecture students. Collaborate on competitions and outreach projects with peers across year groups.

features.title: Societies & Activities
features.description: Join more than 160 student-led societies and volunteering groups through The Students’ Union.
features.imageAlt: Students from UWE societies at a campus fair
points: Academic, cultural, campaigning and wellbeing societies welcoming new members year-round. Regular fairs, skills sessions and takeovers so you can try something new with friends.

features.title: Centre for Sport
features.description: Modern gym, floodlit pitches, indoor courts and over 60 weekly classes on campus.
features.imageAlt: Students training at the UWE Centre for Sport gym
points: Flexible memberships plus pay-as-you-go options. Performance sport pathways, recreational leagues and coached sessions.

features.title: Centre for Music
features.description: Keep performing with rehearsal rooms, recording studios and expert mentors.
features.imageAlt: Students rehearsing in the UWE Centre for Music studio
points: Free instrument loan scheme and bookable practice rooms. Join choirs, bands, DJ workshops and music production masterclasses.

scenes.label: Support
scenes.title: We'll Support You on Your Journey
scenes.headline: Dedicated teams across UWE Bristol are ready to help whenever you need it.

highlight.title: Student Life Hub
highlight.description: Drop-in help for finance, wellbeing, visas, accommodation and getting involved on campus.
highlight.imageAlt: Student Life Hub advisors meeting with a student
points: Friendly Student Life Assistants connect you with expert teams across the university.

services: Out of Hours team counselling (evenings & weekends)

link.label: More on mental health and wellbeing support

note.prefix: If you don’t meet the entry requirements you may be eligible for the Architecture Foundation Course.
